posts.name: scott-signal
posts.cooked:
Hello everyone! The Signal team is releasing a new version of Signal Desktop, v7.42.0-beta.1. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta here.

Release notes:

  • Now when you link your primary Signal device to a new Desktop or iPad, you can bring your chat history and your last 45 days of media with you. The transfer process is end-to-end encrypted, and completely optional. When it comes to making the choice about whether or not to leave the past behind, you’re left to your own devices.

For more information about this feature, you can read our blog post about it..

Note: in order to test this feature, your primary device should be on the latest beta.

Commit changes: Comparing v7.41.0-beta.1…v7.42.0-beta.1 · signalapp/Signal-Desktop · GitHub

Thanks for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Signal >> Blog >> A Synchronized Start for Linked Devices

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.42.0-beta.1

53 new commits since 7.41.0-beta.2:

Show commits

  • v7.42.0-alpha.1 [1]

  • Fix author id for e164-only 1:1 messages [2]

  • Update conversation hero message [3]

  • Update link & sync availability [4]

  • Fix sticker pack download on import [5]

  • Update which messages affect chat list presence on import [6]

  • Advertise both link and sync capabilities [7]

  • Move to MessageCache.saveMessage, queue downloads piecemeal [8]

  • Update electron to 34.0.1 [9]

  • removeFromGroup: Don't use removed member for credentials [10]

  • Roundtrip group.blocked state [11]

  • Disallow conversation model creation during import [12]

  • Upgrade to libsignal-client v0.65.4 [13]

  • Update to latest backup integration tests [14]

  • Use KeepAlive for libsignal-mediated websockets as well [15]

  • Fix QR-code auto-retry logic [16]

  • Upgrade to QuillV2 [17]

  • Fix padding of conversation list [18]

  • Resolve sticker pack references after import [19]

  • Update better-sqlite3 to 9.0.10 [20]

  • Enable link & sync in beta [21]

  • Release Notes Channel: Support image attachments (#9587) [22]

  • Composer: Fix tab completion of mentions and emoji [23]

  • Fix accidental loop during backup import [24]

  • Wrap link preview description for long words (#9662) [25]

  • release notes for 7.41 [26]

  • Update strings [27]

  • Update DNS fallback [28]

  • Fix copy/paste of a single-line of formatting text [29]

  • modifyGroupV2: useCredentialsFrom only when profileKeyCredential needed [30]

  • Fix timestamp capping for storage service [31]

  • Composer: Listen for compose start/end and apply proper styling [32]

  • Fix status of in-flight sticker packs after import [33]

  • Don't fetch remote config twice on startup [34]

  • getProfile: Only clear profile name if profile is missing it [35]

  • Notify libsignal-net on network availability [36]

  • Update behavior during import for missing oneof fields [37]

  • Fix window.SignalDebug.getMessage functions [38]

  • Avoid mute timeouts with invalid delay values [39]

  • Change header visibility in left pane [40]

  • Test processing of unprocessed envelopes [41]

  • Notification token on Windows [42]

  • Release Notes Channel: Add support for server body ranges [43]

  • Upgrade libsignal to v0.65.5 [44]

  • Fix message reaction picker moving when typing stops [45]

  • (Re-)Enable Desktop's /v1/keepalive for libsignal chat websockets too [46]

  • Send typingIndicator only when composer text and formatting has changed [47]

  • Update better-sqlite3 to 9.0.11 [48]

  • downloadAttachment: Log presence/absence of downloadPath [49]

  • Use other sync messages for conversations missing ACI [50]

  • Refactor sticker sync logic [51]

  • Update strings [52]

  • 7.42.0-beta.1 [53]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Desktop v7.41.0-beta.2…v7.42.0-beta.1

  • Update strings [4]

posts.name: Jeffrey
posts.cooked: Looks like Update bot have some same commits from 7.41 beta

posts.name: Fedor Indutny
posts.cooked: This is likely expected. We cut future release branches early and backport changes from the development branch into them so sometimes the commits can look duplicated across releases.
